pages.text: I could quite literally smell this place from afar. Up to now, the things I have encountered in this hellish land have been horrifying, dangerous, mysterious and ancient, but this place is downright putrid.$(br2)The landscape here is made out of flesh, faintly moving and pulsing, and worst of all, warm. Large hunks of bone stick out of the meaty

surfaces, and pools of blood sit stagnant in the abscesses of the ground. Scabs dot the fleshy floor, left by creatures with a less-than-light tread. I was in danger of throwing up.$(br2)Seeing this section of still-warm, still-moving organic matter making up a distressingly substantial portion of the Nether calls into question whether netherrack is truly some sort of rock at all.

This flesh seems to be found specifically within this biome. It seems to... pulse, as if the very landscape is alive. When I step into it, my feet sink somewhat, and my walking is slightly more labored than usual, the flesh suctioning my every step. Truly vile.

pages.title: Hanging Eyes
pages.text: From the ceiling of the biome hang countless eyes, large and small, from their optic muscles. Not creepy at all.$(br2)Breaking these gives me some slime... and seeds to plant more of them! I can now fulfill my dream of feeling like I'm being watched in my own home.

pages.title: Scabs
pages.text: The residents of the Nether seem like they could care less about where they step; the scabbing and scarring here are proof of that. As gross as this place may be, that's gotta hurt.
